facts_pool: Brandon, Manitoba sits on Treaty 2 territory along the Assiniboine River.
Neon signs arenâ€™t all neon; many colors come from argon and phosphor coatings.
The full moon looks larger near the horizon due to a perception illusion, not size.
Luxon wraps the Intl API for proper time zones in JavaScript.
â€˜Feels likeâ€™ temperature uses wind chill or humidex to model perception.
Caffeine half-life averages 5 hoursâ€”yes, your 6pm coffee is still here at midnight.
Most vending machines prefer compliments over kicks. Anecdotally.
Dust is 20â€“50% dead skin in homes. Enjoy that mental image.
A group of crows is called a murder; a group of tabs is called anxiety.
Laughter reduces stress hormones within minutes. Even fake laughs can help.

guides.jail_visitation: ğŸ‘€ while youâ€™re jailed, the rest of the motel can **visit, taunt, and witness**. they can also **vote on your task** to earn freedom (e.g., tasteful toe pic, a scripted DM line, or a silly challenge).
guides.dungeon_access: ğŸ—ï¸ **Dungeon Dwellers** gate NSFW access. you must be **nominated by at least one Dweller**, then the **Dungeon votes** to accept. gives posters a say over who can see their stuff.
mods_jail_steps: Use Moonlight bot â†’ temp role: apply **Jailed (SFW)** or **Jailed (NSFW)** based on the guestâ€™s choice.
Restrict view/send to the chosen jail channel; allow whole server to see & talk in jail.
Set duration in the temp-role tool; remove role auto after expiry.
Post the **freedom task** poll; highest-voted task = the condition for release.

roles.staff_desc: keep the lights steady & exits honest.

guides.commands_hint: try: `chad, ask the motel [your question]` â€¢ `chad, random fact` â€¢ `chad, time in London` â€¢ `chad, weather in Brandon MB` â€¢ `chad, gaslight me` â€¢ whisper to the mirror â€¢ mention the ledger â€¢ count to thirteen â€¢ knock twice and wait.

lore.title: Welcome to The Moonlit Motel â€” A Place Between Places
lore.innkeeper: The Motel did not begin with blueprints. It began with a woman wandering the dark halls of her own mind, learning what people needed most: a place to be soft, loud, messy, and still welcome. She opened a door that wasnâ€™t supposed to existâ€”and the neon flickered awake. The Innkeeper was born.
lore.soupy: Soupy did not arrive. He appeared, like an echo before the sound is remembered. Doors formed under his hands; rooms rearranged themselves around his needs. Glitch, spirit, clone, or first ghostâ€”Soupy taught the Motel how to hold people. Prototype Guest.

staff.sunday: Sundayâ€”keeper of mischief, laughter in dark corners, soft chaos at 3AM. She runs the dungeon levels with grace and menace.
staff.rock: Rockâ€”the grounding force, night desk guardian. Knows when someone needs silence, softness, or a cup of tea placed nearby without a word.
staff.epithet: Twin Clerks of the Night Shift.

lore.what_is_this: This place is a couch to collapse on, a diner booth at midnight, a parked car under streetlights with the music still playing. Weird is welcome. Tired is understood. â€œIâ€™m not okayâ€ doesnâ€™t scare anyone away.
lore.welcome: VACANCY FOR WEIRDOS. Check in as you are. Speak when you want. Rest when you need.
